clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring System for the Wearing of Orthodontic Elastics
clinical_study.official_title: OrthoKontrol - System Zur Überwachung Der Tragedauer Von kieferorthopädischen Gummizügen

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to validate a novel sensor intended to measure the wearing time of orthodontic elastics in patients with multibracket appliances. The newly developped sensor will be tested in 42 patients over a period of 6 months

detailed_description.textblock: Fixed multibracket appliances are used to correct tooth and jaw malocclusions. Usually, elastics are inserted between the upper and lower jaws to adjust the position of the jaws in relation to each other. The wearing time of the elastics determines the duration of the treatment and the quality of the treatment results. While micro-sensors are increasingly used for removable appliances to monitor patient compliance, there is still no such possibility for fixed appliances. This gap is to be closed with the planned 'OrthoKontrol' (intraoral mini-sensor). This is intended to measure and record the wearing time of the elastics.

primary_outcome.description: The wearing comfort for the patient is ok/not ok
The handling for the therapist is ok/not ok

secondary_outcome.description: read on the sensors how long the patients followed the instructions

intervention.description: Fixing OrthoKontrol Sensor on multibracket appliance to measure cooperation

study_pop.textblock: patients with class II malocclusion in treatment with fixed appliances

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Multibracket appliances (fixed braces) in both jaws
- Need for intermaxillary elastics on at least one side
- Minimum motor skills
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with general diseases
- Patients with inflammatory oral diseases
- Patients with physical disabilities, which make it impossible to cooperate
- Independent insertion of the elastics is not possible
- Patients with impaired judgment Pregnant women
